featured.text: In 1499, he arrived at Zanzibar, an archipelago sitting at the crossroads of the Spice Route.
When the paper-thin browned potatoes arrived, the diner was pleased.
When you arrive for pick-up, your dog will be well-exercised and beautiful.
Sometimes it is impossible to deliver all the mail that arrives at the post office.

For example, Superman always arrives in the nick of time to prevent a disaster from happening, Peter Pan can fly at will to tease the bad guy Captain Hook, and Harry Potter has his magic power to take revenge on his uncle, aunt and cousin, who always ill-treat him. 44.

other.text: Before Moran arrived, Yellowstone in the popular imagination was a harsh, wild place with hot water and steam coming out of hellish holes in the ground.

Nowadays many companies adopt a ______ work schedule which allows their employees to decide when to arrive at work—from as early as 6 a.m. to as late as 11 a.m. (A) relative (B) severe (C) primitive (D) flexible 2.
Welcome poles were traditionally placed on village beachfronts to greet visitors arriving by canoe.
I had just arrived by plane and still had jetlag.
The earliest traders arrived around 900 AD. (B)
He just needs to apply for a non-visa entry when he arrives at the CKS airport.

The speaker, carefully programmed, arrived on the stage under its own power and proceeded to tell the audience of 658 graduates, their families, and friends that they would have to learn to work with robots and technology to solve society’s problems.

definition.zh_def: 到達，抵達某地或某個目的地。
definition.en_def: To reach a destination or a place.
definition.example: We will arrive at the airport by noon.
